intro: Kadua smithii, commonly known as Smith's kahili, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of the Hawaiian Islands. Kadua smithii is often found in open, sunny habitats such as coastal dunes and rocky slopes. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important species for ecological studies in Hawaii.
